title: CLAUDE.md
text:
This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.


This is ‚ÄúThe Data Sketchbook‚Äù - a Quarto-based website for technical blogs and talks on machine learning and data science. The site features reproductions of data visualizations and insights from data visualization books.




Quarto Website: The site uses Quarto‚Äôs website project type with automatic execution freezing
Content Structure: Blog posts are stored in posts/ directory, each in its own folder with index.qmd and an images/ subdirectory
Styling: Uses Bootstrap themes (Litera for light mode, Darkly for dark mode) with custom SCSS overrides in custom.scss
Build Output: Generated site files are placed in _site/ directory





_quarto.yml: Main configuration file defining website structure, themes, and build settings
index.qmd: Homepage with blog listing configuration using Quarto‚Äôs listing feature
custom.scss: Custom styling that imports Atkinson Hyperlegible and Fira Code fonts
posts/*/index.qmd: Individual blog post files with YAML frontmatter






quarto preview              # Start development server with live reload
quarto render               # Build the entire website to _site/
quarto publish              # Publish to configured hosting service



quarto create-project blog  # Create new blog post structure





Blog posts use YAML frontmatter with title, author, date, and toc fields
Images should be placed in posts/{post-name}/images/ directory
The site uses automatic execution freezing (freeze: auto) to cache computational results
Custom fonts (Atkinson Hyperlegible for body text, Fira Code for code) are loaded via Google Fonts
Google Analytics is configured with ID ‚ÄòG-4BTEYBVWPE‚Äô





Posts focus on data visualization, machine learning, and data science topics
Include proper attribution for data sources
Use relative paths for images within post directories
Follow the established naming convention for post directories (lowercase with hyphens)

title: The Data Sketchbook
text:
üëã Welcome to The Data Sketchbook
I am a computational scientist with a focus on data science. I started this blog to document my learnings related to data visualization and causal AI. Some posts feature reproductions of visualizations from Flowing Data and insights from books I am studying, such as The Visual Display of Quantitative Information and Effective Visualization.
Recently, I took a break from the industry to explore the use of LLMs in Automated Program Repair and Software Engineering education at SUTD. You can find the report here.
Previously, I worked on developing medical risk prediction models and conducted research in computational neuroscience at the Max Planck Institute.


Posts





Date


Title






March 21, 2025


Singapore Population Pyramid (1970-2024)

title: Singapore Population Pyramid (1970-2024)
text:
Observe how, in the earlier years, the younger age groups make up a larger proportion of the population, as indicated by the wider base. In later years, the older age groups occupy a larger share, while the younger age groups appear relatively smaller. This is reflected in the changing shape of the pyramid, with a gradual shift in the distribution across different age categories.


SOURCE: DEPARTMENT OF STATISTICS, Singapore
